Class WorkflowUtil

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • suspend

        public static void suspend(Workflow workflow)
        In a seperate bundle, Suspend a workflow.
        Parameters:
        workflow - the workflow to suppend This should only be used where you actually want this to occur in a seperate bundle, otherwise you can just call workflow.suppend() directly. I'm not convinced that you really want to call this method, note that you are responsible to handling raw exceptions like ConcurrentDataChangeException, IllegalStateException, etc. Also, this will increment the workflows version, so the page's object may infact cause the CDCE.

      • resumeWorkflow

        public static void resumeWorkflow(Workflow workflow)
        In a seperate bundle, resume a workflow.
        Parameters:
        workflow - the workflow to resume This should only be used where you actually want this to occur in a seperate bundle, otherwise you can just call workflow.resume() directly. I'm not convinced that you really want to call this method, note that you are responsible to handling raw exceptions like ConcurrentDataChangeException, IllegalStateException, etc. Also, this will increment the workflows version, so the page's object may infact cause the CDCE.

      • resumeWorkflows

        public static void resumeWorkflows(Workflow[] workflows)
        In a seperate bundle, resume all workflow.
        Parameters:
        workflows - the workflows to resume

      • resumeAllWorkflows

        public static void resumeAllWorkflows()
        In a seperate bundle, resume all error or suspended workflow.

      • resetActivityWorkflow

        public void resetActivityWorkflow(Activity activity)
        This will reset the activities workflow to null.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity to reset

      • deleteRetiredWorkflowsFromDatabase

        public static void deleteRetiredWorkflowsFromDatabase()
        This will delete the retired workflows from the database. This will delete any work items, log message, and the workflow itself. It does not deal with UserRoleAssignment nor Activity nor any other added foreign key. This is a permanent delete, as opposed to just retiring the workflow. This executes directly against the database, by passing global cache.

      • deleteRetiredWorkflowsFromDatabase

        public static void deleteRetiredWorkflowsFromDatabase(ILinkPropertyInfo[] updateReferences,
                                      ILinkPropertyInfo[] deleteReferences,
                                      ILinkPropertyInfo[] deleteLinks)

      • deleteOldWorkflowsFromDatabase

        public static void deleteOldWorkflowsFromDatabase(int daysOld)
        This will delete the completed workflows older than the specified days. This will delete any work items, log message, and the workflow itself. It does not deal with UserRoleAssignment nor Activity nor any other added foreign key. This is a permanent delete, as opposed to just retiring the workflow.
        Parameters:
        daysOld - the number of days that have passed since the last update of the workflow This executes directly against the database, by passing global cache.

      • deleteOldWorkflowsFromDatabase

        public static void deleteOldWorkflowsFromDatabase(int daysOld,
                                  ILinkPropertyInfo[] updateReferences,
                                  ILinkPropertyInfo[] deleteReferences,
                                  ILinkPropertyInfo[] deleteLinks)

      • deleteTheseWorkflowsFromDatabase

        public static void deleteTheseWorkflowsFromDatabase(java.lang.Long[] ids)
        This will delete the specific workflows. This will delete any work items, log message, and the workflow itself. It does not deal with UserRoleAssignment nor Activity nor any other added foreign key. This is a permanent delete, as opposed to just retiring the workflow.
        Parameters:
        ids - specific is to delete This executes directly against the database, by passing global cache.

                                    ILinkPropertyInfo[] deleteReferences,
                                    ILinkPropertyInfo[] deleteLinks)
